result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin David Trone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Martin David Trone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Martin David Trone was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: SH.V Drug=Pseudoephedrine, Penalty When None Expressed-Misdemeanor], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: to be paid at 25% of prison funds

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.

Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in person in custody with counsel Joseph Pecora.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Matter set over to allow defense to consider proposed plea agreement.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Joseph Pecora appearing on behalf of defendant.
Martin David Trone, defendant does not appear.
Gary L. Luhman appearing as prosecuting attorney.

Violation: Possession of Materials for Manufacturing Methamphetamine; Possession of PARA
Issuing Agency: MPD
Conditions: May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.  May not posssess any drug paraphernalia or other articles, like Ephedrine, Pseudoephedrine, Lithium, Phosphorus and Amonia that can be used to manufacture methamphetamine. May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County without permission of Court, except to travel to Stephenson County for a pending criminal case and to Beard Town, Cass County, IL to visit his ill uncle. Mr Pecora to notify Clerk of Courts the dates the defendant will travel to Cass County before he travels there.

Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Joseph Pecora. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Monroe Police Corporal Jacob A. Towns is sworn in and testifies. Patrolman Towns identifies the Defendant. State informs the Court that there is enough evidence to bind over the Defendant for trial. Defense states that there is not enough evidence and objects to the bind over. Courts states that there is enough evidence for bind over and binds the Defendant for trial. information filed; same charges and penalties. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. Bond continues. Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.  May not posssess any drug paraphernalia or other articles, like Ephedrine, Pseudoephedrine, Lithium, Phosphorus and Amonia that can be used to manufacture methamphetamine.

Martin David Trone, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy M. Taylor. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
